column4: Buddies, I have a problem to access the internet in the last 6 hours now. I have tried to solve it a few times with a few people who helped me, but all had to leave in the middle of it. All I need is someone to guide me for a few minutes through interfaces file, iwconfig, or something similar
could anyone help me with that, please?
Can't access the internet
What was the hardwareagain?  Did you look in the supported hardware page for info on it? HAve you tried fwcutter or ndiswrapper?
What chipset in the card?
do you mean which brand is the card?
It will be the driver, or how it was installed...
Not just the brand of card, but the chipset in the card..  sometimes the same card model will have different chipset
it is intel PRO/wireless 3945 Network connection driver for linux. How can I check the chipset?
I am not a wireless type person, but start with a google on the card to try and get all the info you can then ask again in channel
ok, thanks!
lspci may be all you need
what is "lspci"?
Type it in a cli terminal to get info on your devices.
thanks. cabrioleur: I have done this: sudo /usr/share/doc/libdvdread3/install-css.sh
sudo aptitude install non-free-codecs restricted-extras
did restricted-extras; I will try non-free-codecs as well.
couldn't find a package named "non-free-codecs"
Probably in medibuntu repo
thanks
http://www.serenestudios.co.uk/blog/2008/06/03/ubuntu-hardy-as-a-media-center-part-1-the-basics/        YOu dont need all of that, but parts of it may help
added medibuntu. "Couldn't find any package whose name or description matched "non-free-codecs""
I don't have hardy, I have feisty...
